professions.name: Mining
professions.description: Extracts ore, stone, and rare minerals from veins across the world. Mining is the backbone of weapon/armor forging and engineering, and drives faction logistics.

professions.name: Herbalism
professions.description: Harvests herbs, fungi, and exotic plants used for potions, elixirs, poisons, inks, and enchantment reagents. Herb routes and node knowledge are a key advantage.

professions.name: Skinning
professions.description: Collects hides, furs, sinew, and scales from beasts and monsters. Provides the raw materials needed for leather armor, straps, kits, and certain crafting utilities.

professions.name: Lumbering
professions.description: Gathers timber and specialty woods from forests and groves. Wood is essential for camps, tools, bows, staves, wagons, and many military logistics upgrades.

professions.name: Farming
professions.description: Produces staple foods and livestock products. Farming supports troop upkeep, worker wages, cooking, and stable local economies. Includes animal husbandry (raising animals for meat, hides, and trade).

professions.name: Fishing
professions.description: Harvests fish and coastal resources used in cooking and trade. Fish-heavy diets can provide strong buffs and are often tied to contested water routes.

professions.name: Blacksmithing
professions.description: Smelts ores into ingots and forges weapons, tools, and metal components. Blacksmiths are critical for arming troops and maintaining battlefield readiness.

professions.name: Armorsmithing
professions.description: Crafts durable armor and defensive equipment using metals, leather straps, and reinforcing textiles. Balances protection, mobility, and repair efficiency.

professions.name: Tailoring
professions.description: Weaves fibers into cloth and crafts garments, bags, and magical fabrics. Tailors often supply the economy with storage items and caster gear.

professions.name: Leatherworking
professions.description: Turns hides into leather armor, kits, straps, and utility items. Leatherworking bridges hunting economies with troop protection and repair systems.

professions.name: Alchemy
professions.description: Combines herbs, water, salts, and essences into potions, elixirs, poisons, and flasks. Alchemy powers combat buffs and strategic logistics (healing, speed, stealth).

professions.name: Enchanting
professions.description: Uses dust, essences, crystals, and runestones to enhance gear and create glyph-like utilities. Enchanting is the premium endgame economy due to constant demand.

professions.name: Jewelcrafting
professions.description: Cuts gems and crafts jewelry, sockets, and high-value trade goods. Jewelcrafting ties together mining, enchanting, and elite equipment progression.

professions.name: Engineering
professions.description: Builds gadgets, traps, turrets, and logistical tools (carts, deployables). Engineering scales the world-economy loop by improving worker safety and travel efficiency.

professions.name: Cooking
professions.description: Turns raw food into buff meals and rations. Cooking is always relevant because it supports hero activity, worker efficiency, and troop sustain.
